intro: Galium helodes, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium helodes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
